intern

Class Counter

  • java.lang.Object
    • intern.Counter

  • public class Counter
extends java.lang.Object
    Implements the Counter class specified in the Intern Project Requirements. The counter increments and decrements itself in intervals of one unit; either hour, minute, or second.
    Written on Ubuntu Linux, Eclipse Luna, Java 8 SE.
    Compiled using javac.

    References:
    1) Javadoc command reference page:
    https://docs.oracle.com/javase/7/docs/technotes/tools/windows/javadoc.html#synopsis
    2) Javadoc formatting tutorial page:
    http://www.oracle.com/technetwork/articles/java/index-137868.html
    3) Java 8 API:
    https://docs.oracle.com/javase/8/docs/api/
    4) HTML paragraph tag for use in javadoc:
    http://www.w3schools.com/html/html_paragraphs.asp
    5) HTML characters used in javadoc:
    https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_XML_and_HTML_character_entity_references
    6) JavaFX tutorial:
    http://docs.oracle.com/javafx/2/get_started/jfxpub-get_started.htm

    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Calvin Li

    • Constructor Detail

      • Counter

        public Counter()
        Default Constructor

        Sets the counter to 0:0:0

      • Counter

        public Counter(int h,
               int m,
               int s)
        Parameterized Constructor

        Initializes the counter at the time specified by h,m, and s. Constructor checks if the values of h, m, and s are within bounds; the bounds for each being:
        23 > h ≥ 0
        59 > m ≥ 0
        59 > s ≥ 0 .

        Parameters:
        h - value to initialize hours field to
        m - value to initialize minutes field to
        s - value to initialize seconds field to

    • Method Detail

      • get

        public int[] get()
        Gets an array containing the counter's current time.

        Set functions are not provided because the project instructions requested that the only allowable method to change the Counter time after initialization be incrementing/decrementing each field.

        Returns:
        integer array containing current time

      • displayStandard

        public java.lang.String displayStandard()
        Displays the counters current time in Standard 12-hour format.

        Since most display mediums can be expected to use strings, strings with format tags are also provided.

        Returns:
        String containing current counter time in Standard 12-hour format

      • displayMilitary

        public java.lang.String displayMilitary()
        Displays the counter's current time in Military 24-hour format.

        Since most display mediums can be expected to use strings, strings with format tags are also provided.

        Returns:
        String containing current counter time in Military 24-hour format

      • incrementHour

        public void incrementHour()
        Increases the value in the counter's hours field by one.

        If the value of hours field before increment is equal to 23, rolls over the counter to 0:0:0.

      • incrementMinute

        public void incrementMinute()
        Increases the value in the counter's minutes field by one.

        If value of minutes field before increment is equal to 59, calls incrementHour. For example, incrementing 0:59:0 yields 1:0:0.

      • incrementSecond

        public void incrementSecond()
        Increases the value in the counter's seconds field by one.

        If value of seconds field before increment is equal to 59, calls incrementMinute. For example, incrementing 0:0:59 yields 0:1:0.

      • decrementHour

        public void decrementHour()
        Decreases the value in the counter's hours field by one.

        If value of hours field before decrement is equal to 0, sets counter to 23:59:59.

      • decrementMinute

        public void decrementMinute()
        Decreases the value in the counter's minutes field by one.

        If value of minutes field before decrement is equal to 0, sets minutes and seconds field to 59, and calls decrementHour. For example, decrementing 2:0:25 yields 1:59:59.

      • decrementSecond

        public void decrementSecond()
        Decreases the value in the counter's seconds field by one.

        If value of seconds field before decrement is equal to 0, sets seconds field to 59, and calls decrementMinute. For example, decrementing 2:2:0 yields 2:1:59.
